S_su: Monosaccharides from lactose in acid whey (high sugars)
S_aa: Amino acids from soluble whey proteins (moderate proteins)
S_fa: Long chain fatty acids (low lipids in acid whey)
S_pro: Propionate representing part of lactic acid conversion products
S_ac: Acetate elevated due to lactic acid fermentation (acid whey)
S_IC: Inorganic carbon consistent with 20 meq/L alkalinity at pH 5.5
S_IN: Ammonium nitrogen adjusted to meet TKN with organic-N
S_I: Soluble inerts (fresh dairy waste low inerts ~1.5% COD)
S_cat: OTHER cations (Na+, Ca2+) assumed minimal for balance
S_an: OTHER anions (Cl-, SO4--) to achieve electroneutrality at pH 5.5
S_co2: Dissolved CO2 consistent with S_IC at pH 5.5
X_pr: Particulate proteins negligible; whey proteins largely soluble here
X_li: Particulate lipids kept low as in acid whey
X_c4: Valerate and butyrate degrading biomass (inlet, low)
X_I: Particulate inerts kept low but present to match TSS
S_K: Free potassium in solution (bio-P bound K+ handled via X_PP)
S_Mg: Free magnesium in solution (bio-P bound Mg2+ via X_PP)
X_PP: Polyphosphate storage; remainder of TP (bio-P active)
